concise_definition: n. 折痕, 线痕; v. 使起皱, 使有折痕

definitions.explanation_en: A long, narrow line or ridge formed by folding or pressing, especially in fabric, paper, or skin.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过折叠或按压形成的细长线状或脊状痕迹，尤指在布料、纸张或皮肤上。
definitions.example_en: She smoothed out the creases in her dress before the meeting.
definitions.example_cn: 她在会议前把裙子上的褶皱抚平了。

definitions.explanation_en: A natural line or mark on the skin, especially one formed by aging, such as a wrinkle on the forehead or around the eyes.
definitions.explanation_cn: 皮肤上因老化而自然形成的线条或痕迹，例如额头或眼角的皱纹。
definitions.example_en: His deep creases told the story of a life full of hardship.
definitions.example_cn: 他脸上的深深皱纹诉说着饱经风霜的一生。

definitions.explanation_en: To make a long, narrow line or ridge in a surface by folding, pressing, or bending, especially in material like cloth or paper.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过折叠、按压或弯曲，在表面（尤指布料或纸张）上形成一条细长的线或脊状痕迹。
definitions.example_en: Be careful not to crease the important document when you fold it.
definitions.example_cn: 折叠这份重要文件时，小心别弄出折痕。

definitions.explanation_en: To form wrinkles or lines on the skin, especially due to age, emotion, or repeated movement.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因年龄、情绪或反复动作而在皮肤上形成皱纹或线条。
definitions.example_en: Smiling frequently has creased her face around the eyes.
definitions.example_cn: 经常微笑使她眼角出现了皱纹。

comparison.analysis: “Wrinkle” (皱纹) 通常指皮肤上因老化或表情而形成的细小、不规则的褶皱，多用于描述人或有机物表面；而 “crease” 更强调由外力折叠或压出的清晰、规则的线状痕迹，可用于布料、纸张等硬质材料，语义范围更广。
“Fold” (折叠) 是一个动作，指将物体弯曲成两层或多层；而 “crease” 是折叠后留下的结果——即折痕。前者是过程，后者是产物。例如：You fold the paper, and it leaves a crease.
“Line” (线) 是一个泛指的几何或视觉痕迹，可以是画出来的、自然形成的或抽象的；而 “crease” 特指由物理压力或折叠产生的三维凹陷痕迹，具有明确的物理形态和触感，语义更具体。
